Text: The Archdeaconry of St Andrews was a sub-division of the diocese of St Andrews, one of two archdeaconries within the diocese.

<Text: Archdeaconry of St Andrews:  In the medieval period, the Archdeaconry of St Andrews contained five deaneries with a total of 124 parish churches.>

Triplets:<Archdeaconry of St Andrews
3:
--------------------
Text: Archdeaconry of St Andrews:  The deaneries were Mearns (14 churches), Angus (38 churches), Gowrie (20 churches), Fife (28 churches) and Fothriff (24 churches).
